com.opportunity.ui

Class Card

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JLabel
            • com.opportunity.ui.Card
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants

    public class Card
extends javax.swing.JLabel
    This class models one Card Label on the screen. All the labels that display cards (except perhaps the Discard and the Deck, which do not directly display a card image anyway) are instances of this Card class.
    Author:
    Ryan Dimaunahan and Lance Alcabasa
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Card()
      Creates one card and initializes its default properties (medium sized, blue border).
      Card(int count)
      Creates one card, sets the text of the card to the value of count (this will show on the screen) and initializes its default properties (medium sized, blue border).
      Card(java.lang.String name)
      Creates one card, sets its name to the String parameter passed (this will show on the screen) and initializes its default properties (medium sized, blue border).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Card

        public Card(int count)
        Creates one card, sets the text of the card to the value of count (this will show on the screen) and initializes its default properties (medium sized, blue border).
        Parameters:
        count - is the number that will be displayed on the card.

      • Card

        public Card(java.lang.String name)
        Creates one card, sets its name to the String parameter passed (this will show on the screen) and initializes its default properties (medium sized, blue border).
        Parameters:
        name - is the text that will be displayed on the card.

      • Card

        public Card()
        Creates one card and initializes its default properties (medium sized, blue border).

    • Method Detail

      • changeSize

        public void changeSize(int dimension)
        This method changes the size of the card. Use the constants defined in the CardImageLoader class to select which card size to change this card into.
        Parameters:
        dimension - is the new size of the card. Use the constants defined in the CardImageLoader class.
        See Also:
        CardImageLoader

      • setEmpty

        public void setEmpty(boolean isEmpty)
        Set the emtpy property of this card. Also removes the current image of the card in case the value was set to false. Setting this to true without changing the card image would result in a color-filled card without a card image, so use this method with care.
        Parameters:
        isEmpty - a boolean value that tells whether the card should be emtpy or not.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        This method checks if the card is currently empty.
        Returns:
        true if the card is empty, false otherwise.

      • setImage

        public void setImage(javax.swing.ImageIcon icon)
        This method sets the ImageIcon of the card. To use this method, please use the corresponding methods from the CardImageLoader class. For example, to set the card image of an investment card label, you may use the following method call from within your ClickAction subclass: this.getOpportunityUI().getInvestmentCardOfPlayer(1, 0).setImage(this.getOpportunityUI().getCardImageLoader().getLargeImageIconFor(CardImageLoader.KAREN_DAIRY_A_LVL0)) Or you may use the various helper methods from getOpportunityUI: this.getOpportunityUI().setCardImageOfInvestmentCard(1, 0, CardImageLoader.KAREN_DAIRY_A_LVL0) The two codes perform the same task.
        Parameters:
        icon - the image you want to set as the image of the card. Use the CardImageLoader to load the specific card image.
        See Also:
        CardImageLoader

      • removeImage

        public void removeImage()
        This method removes the current image of the card and makes the card empty. This method automatically calls the setEmpty() method of the card to empty the card.

      • getCurrentImage

        public int getCurrentImage()
        This method returns an integer value corresponding to the current image currently being displayed by the card. If the card is empty, this method will return the value of the constant CardImageLoader.NO_IMAGE.
        Returns:
        integer current Image of this card corresponding to the constants in the CardImageLoader class
        See Also:
        CardImageLoader
